Singapore 25 The purpose of this communication is to describe our experience and highlight our 53 approach with reference to the ACS and SIR recommendations in provision of 54 endovascular services during the first ten weeks as the hospital attending to the 55 highest number of COVID-19 patients in the country. This manuscript fulfils our 56 institutional criteria for waiver of ethics board approval. 57 58 On 23 rd January 2020, Singapore confirms her first case of coronavirus patient, and 59 within two weeks reported the highest confirmed number of cases outside of China. 60

Since, our institution is experiencing the fourth wave of infection -first wave, 61 imported cases from China (<100 cases, February to mid-March); second wave, 62 occurrence of limited isolated local clusters (<1000 cases, February to mid-March); 63 third wave, returning overseas local and sustained community transmission (>1000 64 cases, early April); and fourth wave, decreasing community transmission but 65 explosion of foreign worker dormitory cluster (>5000 cases, mid-April) which 66 constitutes >60% of the total cases. 3 Singapore imposed island-wide limited 67 lockdown, termed "circuit breaker", in early April. Apart from access to NCID angiography suite, 96 there are two angiography systems sited within radiology department. To conclude, provision of endovascular service will require a certain degree of 123 rationalization to dovetail with the over-riding medical effort during this pandemic. 124

From our experience, the ACS and SIR case-based classification is a feasible guide 125 but as this pandemic drags on and looks set to be protracted, innovative solutions 126 will be needed, in resource constrained healthcare systems, to reduce the impact on 127 patients requiring endovascular care. 128 129

FIGREF2.text: 100 As per the guidelines, high acuity cases with life or limb-threatening conditions are 101 not postponed. Case in point, a patient with history of Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis 102 developed acute bilateral lower limb ischemia with CT proven saddle embolus, 103 bilateral iliac artery occlusion sequelae, and a 3 cm aortic arch free-floating thrombus 104 just distal to the left subclavian artery as the embolic source. Patient underwent right 105 femoral embolectomy and endovascular thoracic stent graft placement to jail the clot 106 and prevent further embolic events. 107 108 Our institutional case-mix showed no significant change in the number of 109 endovascular cases in the same 10-week period this year and 2019.
